xxl.cursors
Class WhileRemover

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--xxl.cursors.DecoratorCursor
        |
        +--xxl.cursors.Remover
              |
              +--xxl.cursors.WhileRemover
public class WhileRemover
extends Remover

A WhileRemover removes the elements of an input-Iterator with the help of a user-defined predicate.
It removes the elements of an input-Iterator as long as the result of the user-defined predicate applied to the next element of the input-Iterator is true.

An instance of WhileRemover is created as follows: 

 	super(new WhileTaker(cursor, predicate));
So simply a WhileTaker is created that selects the elements with the help of the given predicate and this instance of a WhileTaker is used as the input-Iterator of a Remover.

Note: An input-PeekIterator or input-Iterator is wrapped to a Cursor. If the peek method is not supported by the input-Cursor, it is wrapped to a BufferedCursor to guarantee this functionality.

See Also:
Remover, WhileTaker, Predicate

Constructor Detail

WhileRemover

public WhileRemover(Iterator iterator,
                    Predicate predicate)
Creates a new WhileRemover backed on an Iterator and a predicate applied on the Iterator's elements. The Iterator's elements will be removed from the input-Iterator as long as the specified predicate returns true.
The implementation is as follows: 

 	super(new WhileTaker(cursor, predicate));
So a WhileTaker is created that selects the elements with the help of the given predicate and this instance of a WhileTaker is used as the input-Iterator of a Remover.
Parameters:
iterator - the input-Iterator the elements will be removed from as long as the specified predicate applied on the current element returns true.
predicate - the predicate used to select the elements of the input-Iterator.
